reviewText: Looks like the director bought a cheap camcorder, got a few friends around to watch his collection of Friday 13th and Halloween DVDs and then just sent them out into the woods to improvise a movie.Blood Reaper is extremely formulaic, with a semi-supernatural masked villain (who can apparently be in two places at once, or else can cover great distances at phenomenal speed) going on a killing spree. Dialogue is very stilted, the blood and guts are always less than convincing and there are plot-holes that Freddy Krueger could drive a school bus through.Some jerky, hand-held camera work is, presumably, meant to emulate Blair Witch, but could just be because the camcorder used to film this didn't have a stabilising picture facility!No real shocks, and the pursuit sequences had more than a whiff of Benny Hill about them (run away from the maniac, take a breather, turn around and he's right behind you, so scream, jump up in the air and run away again).Had the director decided to play it for laughs a la Evil Dead 2, it would probably have worked more successfully.Blood Reaper is /just/  rescued from being a lone star movie by a decent rocking soundtrack, one genuinely creepy scene with a strange old woman camper trying to feed a doll, and the fact that the final woman victim can actually act a bit and looks like an ex-girlfriend of mine!
summary: Ultra low budget, highly derivative gorefest.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I love horror films and am a particularly big slasher fan, but Blood Reaper is scraping the bottom of the barrel.I'm all for independent films and low budget flicks, but this is seriously taking the piss. The acting is terrible - so much so that its a joy when the characters are offed, I was hoping they all would be - for a start, the story is non-existant - thats usually expected, but this film deserves no mercy - and stupid, the production values are terrible.During one of the death scenes, for example, there were so many inaccuracies that I was left focusing more on the mistakes made by the film makers than the film itself.A massive waste of time and - albeit not very much - money. Don't spend your money on this garbage, its not worth it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: the first character of the opening credits only has a very small part and gets killed at the first yet gets top billing of characters. The story is a group of campers who one by one gets killed in the woods by this killer who wears a type of gas mask and we NEVER know who it is. Alot of of stupid scenes where the killer is at one place chasing a victim then the scene changes and the killer is chasing another victim but what happened to the first victim? The scene changes back and the first victim who is still alive and the killer appears out of nowhere to do  the kill. There is no nudity yet a couple of sex scenes. ok? Bad acting. bad script. dull knife cutting rope that seems impossable to be cut yet the knife is sharp enough to be thown into the killers throat by one of the victims. The DVD has only 5 chapers making each chapter about 20 minutes long. If you have to stop the DVD you really have to fast foward through the chapter to find where you left off. The ONLY reason I'm not giving the trash 1 star is I like the body of two of the females.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A long-time horror fan, it's sad to see how low our current horror films can sink.  BLOOD REAPER is a very bad and stupid little movie.  Horror queen Brinke Stevens, not really a good actress, gets top billing for about ten minutes of screen time in the opening sequence, the rest of the cast is simply awful.  The plot, what little there is, revolves around a legendary killer who escaped from a nuthouse and kills people (campers) whenever there's a full moon.  Then explain why many of the murders occur in broad daylight, and there are two full moons in a row???Shot with a hand held video camera, BLOOD REAPER is at the bottom of the horror barrel.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Weak production value along with weak performances will have you wondering how this even got to a dvd . The execution of a rediculious plot is almost funny to see , but its not a comedy . This is a seriously flawed movie but that is the nature of many low budget horror films . Its ok to watch once and than give away. Certainly Sub par but Ive seen worse, but not much worse. The dvd doesnt have any Extras but if it did it should of featured an APOLOGY for wasting your time on it . For laughs watch cause its funny BAD ,but for enjoyment you wont find any! This is a bad movie!

summary: Worse than a 'B' movie, but I like it anyway.
